Company: Mariner Health Care Inc. and SavaSeniorCare Administrative Services LLC
Description: Atlanta-based Mariner Health Care Inc. and SavaSeniorCare Administrative Services LLC, as well as their principals, Leonard Grunstein, Murray Forman and Rubin Schron, agreed to pay the United States and several states $14 million .The settlement arose from allegations that the defendants solicited kickback payments from Omnicare in exchange for agreements by Mariner and Sava to continue using Omnicare's pharmacy services for 15 years.
back pay award in unfair labor practices case

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: Mariner Health Care, Inc. and Sava Senior Care Administrative Services, LLC
Description: Mariner Health Care and SavaSeniorCare Administrative Services agreed to pay $6.16 million to settle multistate litigation alleging they solicited kickback payments from Omnicare in exchange for commitments to use its pharmacy services. This was part of a larger $14 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/ga-mariner-health-care-inc-and-savaseniorca
